io.spine.server.aggregate

Class AggregateRepository<I,A extends Aggregate<I,?,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.entity.Repository<I,A>
      • io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateRepository<I,A>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of the aggregate IDs
    A - the type of the aggregates managed by this repository
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.spine.logging.Logging, MessageDispatcher<io.spine.core.CommandClass,io.spine.core.CommandEnvelope,I>, UnicastDispatcher<io.spine.core.CommandClass,io.spine.core.CommandEnvelope,I>, CommandDispatcher<I>, Shardable, RepositoryView<I,A>, EventDispatcherDelegate<I>, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggregatePartRepository

    public abstract class AggregateRepository<I,A extends Aggregate<I,?,?>>
extends Repository<I,A>
implements CommandDispatcher<I>, EventDispatcherDelegate<I>, Shardable
    The repository which manages instances of Aggregates.

    This class is made abstract for preserving type information of aggregate ID and aggregate classes used by implementations.

    A repository class may look like this: 

     
  public class OrderRepository extends AggregateRepository<OrderId, OrderAggregate> {
      public OrderRepository() {
          super();
      }
  }

    • Method Detail

      • onRegistered

        public void onRegistered()
        The callback called by a BoundedContext during the registration of the repository.

        If entities managed by this repository are versionable, registers itself as a type supplier with the Stand of the parent parent BoundedContext.

        Registers itself with the CommandBus of the parent BoundedContext.

        Overrides:
        onRegistered in class Repository<I,A extends Aggregate<I,?,?>>

      • dispatch

        public I dispatch(io.spine.core.CommandEnvelope envelope)
        Dispatches the passed command to an aggregate.

        The aggregate ID is obtained from the passed command.

        The repository loads the aggregate by this ID, or creates a new aggregate if there is no aggregate with such ID.

        Specified by:
        dispatch in interface MessageDispatcher<io.spine.core.CommandClass,io.spine.core.CommandEnvelope,I>
        Parameters:
        envelope - the envelope of the command to dispatch
        Returns:
        ID(s) of entities to which the message was dispatched

      • onError

        public void onError(io.spine.core.CommandEnvelope envelope,
                    java.lang.RuntimeException exception)
        Handles the given error.

        If the given error is a rejection, posts the rejection event into the EventBus. Otherwise, logs the error.

        Specified by:
        onError in interface MessageDispatcher<io.spine.core.CommandClass,io.spine.core.CommandEnvelope,I>
        Parameters:
        envelope - the command which caused the error
        exception - the error occurred during processing of the command

      • setSnapshotTrigger

        protected void setSnapshotTrigger(int snapshotTrigger)
        Changes the number of events between making aggregate snapshots to the passed value.

        The default value is defined in AggregateRepository.DEFAULT_SNAPSHOT_TRIGGER.

        Parameters:
        snapshotTrigger - a positive number of the snapshot trigger

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • fetchHistory

        protected java.util.Optional<io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord> fetchHistory(I id)
        Fetches the history of the Aggregate with the given ID.

        To read an AggregateStateRecord from an AggregateStorage, a snapshot trigger is used as a batch size.

        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the Aggregate to fetch
        Returns:
        the AggregateStateRecord for the Aggregate or Optional.empty() if there is no record with the ID

      • play

        protected A play(I id,
                 io.spine.server.aggregate.AggregateStateRecord history)
        Plays the given Aggregate history for an instance of Aggregate with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the Aggregate to load
        history - the state record of the Aggregate to load
        Returns:
        an instance of Aggregate

      • find

        public java.util.Optional<A> find(I id)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Loads an aggregate by the passed ID.

        An aggregate will be loaded despite its visibility. I.e. even if the aggregate is archived or deleted, it is loaded and returned.

        Specified by:
        find in interface RepositoryView<I,A extends Aggregate<I,?,?>>
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the aggregate to load
        Returns:
        the loaded object or Optional.empty() if there are no events for the aggregate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage of the repository is not initialized prior to this call
        See Also:
        AggregateStateRecord

      • getEventEndpointDelivery

        @SPI
protected AggregateDelivery<I,A,io.spine.core.EventEnvelope,?,?> getEventEndpointDelivery()
        Defines a strategy of event delivery applied to the instances managed by this repository.

        By default uses direct delivery.

        Descendants may override this method to redefine the strategy. In particular, it is possible to postpone dispatching of a certain event to a particular aggregate instance at runtime.

        Returns:
        delivery strategy for events applied to the instances managed by this repository

      • getCommandEndpointDelivery

        protected AggregateDelivery<I,A,io.spine.core.CommandEnvelope,?,?> getCommandEndpointDelivery()
        Defines a strategy of command delivery applied to the instances managed by this repository.

        By default uses direct delivery.

        Descendants may override this method to redefine the strategy. In particular, it is possible to postpone dispatching of a certain command to a particular aggregate instance at runtime.

        Returns:
        delivery strategy for rejections

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: Repository
        Closes the repository by closing the underlying storage.

        The reference to the storage becomes null after this call.
